content.description: This climb has very gritty face moves up a knobby crack. Traverse in from the right on a large ledge system to the base of the route.
content.location:
Just to the left of

Roofing Company

.

content.description:
Climb a short vertical crack and then head out the prominent roof which goes much easier than appearances suggest due to the many small edges for your feet and some massive flakes for your hands. Two stars out of five.

Also known, long ago, as the "Price Ceiling".

climbs.name: Roast Leg of Chair
climbs.fa: Steve Godshall, John Wolfe and Mona Stahl, October 1971

content.description:
A nice, single pitch trad route on the left-hand side of the Monkey Business Wall.

The first section consists of a slabby ramp with a few cracks/flakes that will take smaller active/passive projection (recommend smaller cams on the flakes). You can follow the original line (as annotated with the hashed markings veering left) or you can take the more direct slab ramp (annotated along continuous red line) leading up to the base of the prominent and right-most crack leading to the base of the giant block atop the wall/feature.

There are no bolts along the route or anchor hardware at the top. Once completing the route, simply walk off and scramble down the opposite side of the face (NNW of the feature). Leader can set up an anchor station using protection and slings at the top to belay the seconding climber.
content.protection:
Ample options for small to medium sized passive and active protection (BD Camalots #2 and smaller / nuts of all sizes / BD hexcentrics of medium to smaller size) throughout the entire route.

The first 20-30 feet of the route requires the smallest sized protection with the second half of the route consisting of a generous crack ideal for placing passive pro (nuts/stoppers/hexcentrics) if so inclined.
content.location: This route is located along the left-hand portion of the Monkey Business Wall, located on the SW Face of Little Hunk within the greater Echo Rock Area.

climbs.name: Right Between the Eyes
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Yvonne McPherson, February 1989

content.description: This horizontal route can easily be seen when walking towards the southwest end of Little Hunk from Echo Rock.  The route starts on a sandy (be careful) ledge below two closely spaced roof climbs on the wall's right hand side (Roofing Company & Monkey Business).  Climb left about 15 feet until the moves pull you up 6 feet and then continue left on large holds to a thinner finish at a chain belay next to a shrub oak.  CAUTION:  The Vogel guide has the picture wrong on page 251.  It shows the climb going straight left from the start.  This would be much harder 5.10+? and not take you to the anchors, which are not where pictured either.
content.protection: Standard J-Tree rack and remember to place gear for the second!!  Also, it would be wise to anchor the belayer at the start of the route.

climbs.name: Psychocandy
climbs.fa: Alan Bartlett and Chris Miller, October 1992

content.description:
Climb

Roast Leg of Chair

to an obvious ledge and then move slightly left below a headwall (optional belay here); continue up the plated face above to reach a curving thin crack (crux) that leads to the top.

Originally done in two pitches but it can be done in a single pitch if mindful of rope drag.
content.protection: Gear to 3 inches, include many slings
content.location:
Shares the first portion with

Roast Leg of Chair

and then breaks left up a plated face to crack. Â Descend via easy downclimb to climber's left, putting you near the base of Transformers, Groove Avoidance System, and other climbs in the notch.

content.description: A nice little sport route on good rock.  Crux is at mid height with another mini crux right at the top.  Rating a bit height dependant, and luck dependant if you shoot for any out of reach holds.
content.protection: 4 bolts and one fixed pin.  Gated shuts at the top.
content.location: This route is just to the right of Maw.  Maw and Pa are on the South Face of the formation.  If you continue around to the right of these routes about 50ft you will see the route Point Of No Return.

content.description: This exciting route is the rightmost of two prominent right facing roofs on the right side of Little Hunk's southwest end.  At first glance, it would seem harder than its rating but after a closer look you'll see edges for your feet and an edge for crimping through the mid-roof crux.  After pulling the roof a boulder is back behind the climb with a sling on it and a couple of rap rings.  Not the best anchor but it works and drops you right back to the start of the route.
content.protection: This roof crack is really just one size throughout at a #3 to #4 camalot.  I didn't have the fancier new camalots but a #3.5 would be perfect.  A red alien will protect the crux if you can set it before committing to the move.

content.description: Sort of an odd route.  It is a very segmented pitch with easy boulder problems at each bolt.  Do a problem, stand on a ledge... do a problem, stand on an ledge.  There are chain anchors on the top of the formation to rap from.  If you want to rap after doing Monkey Business you can scramble up to these anchors and then TR this route as a bonus.
content.location: This route is just right of an old top rope called Wage and Price Ceiling.  It starts just around the corner to the SW of Monkey Business.
